ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Right Internuclear Ophthalmoplegia (INO)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of right pontine stroke; VOG shows disconjugate saccades with lag in right eye adduction and gaze-evoked nystagmus in the left eye.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Left Reduced Vestibular Response
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Caloric testing shows 48% left weakness; etiology may be peripheral or related to central pathway involvement from the stroke.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess otolith function (saccule) and inferior vestibular nerve integrity in patient with imbalance.
Evaluate for spontaneous or gaze-evoked nystagmus indicating central or peripheral pathology.
Assess central oculomotor function, specifically looking for disconjugate eye movements consistent with INO.
Evaluate central vestibular function; sensitive to central pathology.
Assess central oculomotor function using full-field visual stimulation.
Assess lateral semicircular canal function and determine if a peripheral vestibular weakness exists.
Evaluate functional balance and sensory integration.
Assess vestibulo-ocular reflex over a range of frequencies.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Evaluation confirms central vestibular pathology consistent with the history of right pontine stroke. The primary finding is a persistent Right Internuclear Ophthalmoplegia (INO), characterized by disconjugate saccades (lag in right eye adduction) and gaze-evoked nystagmus in the left eye. There is also a significant left reduced vestibular response (48%) and bilaterally absent cVEMPs. Posturography and rotational chair testing were normal.

tests.name: Video-oculography (Gaze)
tests.result_summary: 4Â°/s leftward beating gaze nystagmus present for leftward gaze without fixation in the left (abducting) eye only.

tests.name: Video-oculography (Saccades)
tests.result_summary: Disconjugate saccades consistent with Right INO; lag noted in the right (adducting) eye when moving leftward.

tests.name: Bithermal Caloric Irrigation
tests.result_summary: 48% left reduced vestibular response. No spontaneous nystagmus.

proposed_items: Continue physical activities as much as possible.
Minimize exposure to complex visual environments (e.g., crowded marketplaces) that require rapid saccadic adjustments.
counseling_actions: Explain that the persistent imbalance is due to the coordination problem between the eyes (INO) and left-sided vestibular weakness.
Clarify that the 'lag' in the right eye causes visual distortion during rapid head movements.
Advise moving the head more slowly to allow eyes to track together effectively.
Counsel on safety and caution in busy visual environments.

escalation.rationale_short: Continued management of post-stroke symptoms including diplopia, imbalance, and mood changes.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor resolution of INO, imbalance, and manage post-stroke comorbidities.

expected_outcome: Neurology follow-up 18 months post-stroke: Patient reported continued diplopia and imbalance.
Patient experienced significant post-stroke depression and insomnia.
